subdisciplines.name: Cliometrics
subdisciplines.description: A quantitative approach to economic history that combines economic theory and statistical methods to study historical phenomena.

subdisciplines.name: Marxian Economics
subdisciplines.description: A branch of economic thought based on the writings of Karl Marx that emphasizes the role of class struggle and exploitation in understanding economic institutions and processes.

subdisciplines.name: New Institutional Economics
subdisciplines.description: The study of how economic institutions affect economic behavior and outcomes over time.

subdisciplines.name: New Economic History
subdisciplines.description: An approach to economic history that uses economic theory and quantitative methods to study historical phenomena, often emphasizing the role of institutions and organizations in shaping economic outcomes.

subdisciplines.name: Cliometrics
subdisciplines.description: A quantitative approach to economic history that combines economic theory and statistical methods to study historical phenomena.

subdisciplines.name: Development Economics
subdisciplines.description: The study of economic development and growth in low-income countries, often focusing on issues of poverty reduction, inequality, and institutional change.
